intro: Pagiantha sphaerocarpa, commonly known as the globe-fruit or African starfruit, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small shrub that produces distinctive, spherical, yellowish fruits with a rough, bumpy surface. The plant belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and melons, and is characterized by its tendrils and lobed leaves. The fruit is edible when mature and has a sweet, tangy flavor, though it is not as widely cultivated as other members of its family. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in open woodlands and savannas.
